page.title: 10BIOGRAPHY , TILSTON
page.content: Mr.Johnson is{88 yrs old}and has lived in the same house all his life.It originally was a{thatched cottage}but has since been modernised. He attended the village school until he was{14 when he left to serve an {apprenticeship}with his father who was the village{cobbler and shoemaker. At school he attended{scripture}every morning. The games he remembers playing were{football, conkers and {marbles.}The children would collect the marble stoppers from the pop bottles! The headmaster inspected childrens shoes every day to see that they were polished.Mr Johnson's father made shoes for local people but he had to wait until{Christmas}for payment from the local farm helpers because that was when they got paid.To go out of the village Mr.Johnson travelled to{Broxton station}by pony and trap.
